p: Prednisolone significantly affected body weight ( P < 0.001; mean difference − 1.1 kg), GFR (p = 0.01; +0.6 mL/kg/min), SDMA ( P < 0.001; −2.4 μg/dL), creatinine ( P < 0.001; −14.4 μmol/L), urea ( P < 0.001; +1.53 mmol/L), chlorides ( P < 0.001; −8.9 mmol/L), bicarbonates ( P = 0.006; +1.4 mmol/L), magnesium ( P < 0.001; +0.19 mmol/L), total proteins ( P < 0.001; +6.3 g/L), albumin ( P < 0.001; +8.7 g/L), tBWC (p = 0.022; −43 mL/kg), urine specific gravity ( P < 0.007; −0.015) and voided urine ( P < 0.001; +274 mL). SDMA ( r = −0,51) and creatinine ( r = −0,74) correlated significantly (p = 0,001) with GFR. All variations became non‐significant after the wash‐out.
